Package DSA.Searching

Class peekElementInMountainArray

  • java.lang.Object
    • DSA.Searching.peekElementInMountainArray
  • public class peekElementInMountainArray
extends java.lang.Object
    The peekElementInMountainArray class provides a method to find the index of the peak element in a mountain array. A mountain array is defined as an array where elements first increase to a peak and then decrease.

    • Method Detail

      • getPeekRecursion

        public static int getPeekRecursion​(int[] nums,
                                   int start,
                                   int end)
        Finds the index of a peak element in a mountain array using recursion. A peak element is defined as an element that is greater than its neighbors. This method uses a divide-and-conquer approach to efficiently locate a peak by recursively narrowing the search space based on the relationship between the middle element and its right neighbor.
        Parameters:
        nums - an array of integers representing a mountain array, where there is guaranteed to be at least one peak.
        start - the starting index of the current search range.
        end - the ending index of the current search range.
        Returns:
        the index of a peak element in the array. The method operates as follows: 1. If the `start` index equals the `end` index, it means a peak has been found at that index, and the method returns `start`. 2. Calculate the midpoint index of the current search range. 3. Compare the midpoint element with its right neighbor: - If the midpoint element is greater than its right neighbor, the peak must be in the left half of the array (including the midpoint). The method recursively calls itself with the left half. - If the midpoint element is less than or equal to its right neighbor, the peak must be in the right half of the array. The method recursively calls itself with the right half, starting just after the midpoint.

      • getPeekelement

        public static int getPeekelement​(int[] nums)
        Finds the index of the peak element in a mountain array. The peak element is the highest element that is greater than its neighbors.
        Parameters:
        nums - an array of integers representing a mountain array
        Returns:
        the index of the peak element

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main method to test the getPeekelement method.
        Parameters:
        args - command-line arguments (not used)
